Authority: Issuer: Meiji Emperor 明治天皇
Curator's comments: 十圓 (明治３年) (identified by Shinichi Sakuraki)

From C.C. Vermeule, "Japanese Coins in the British Museum, (part 1)", Numismatic Chronicle 1954, p. 192: "Japanese coinage of the modern period (1870 to date). 10 yen: The collection includes a proof specimen of the Meiji 3 (1870) gold 10 yen, which is listed as exceptionally rare and unlocated in Japanese collections (Pl.XIV, 9). The diameter of the die is 30 mm. Another slightly less well preserved specimen was Lot 1369 in The Palace Collections of Egypt, Sotheby Sale of 24 February-7 march 1954; it is now in the possession of Messrs. A.H. Baldwin & Sons Ltd., London."
Bibliographic references: Vermeule 1954 / Japanese Coins in the British Museum (Part 1) (p.192, illust. pl.XIV, no.9)
Smith et al 1990 / Japanese Art: Masterpieces in the British Museum (125 r)
Exhibition history: Exhibited: 2006 Oct 13- 2011, April BM Japanese Galleries, 'Japan from prehistory to the present'
Acquisition notes: One of two 'oriental gold coins' purchased.
